entry.title: High Surf Advisory issued September 17 at 2:09PM SST by NWS
entry.summary: ...A HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH FRIDAY... WHAT...Surfs of 9 to 12 feet WHERE...East and south shores WHEN...Through Friday IMPACTS...Expect some strong breaking waves, shorebreak, and strong longshore and rip currents making water recreation difficult and
entry.cap:areaDesc: Manua; Rose Atoll; Swains Island; Tutuila and Aunuu

entry.summary: ...A WIND ADVISORY IS IN EFFECT STARTING TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY... * Breezy trades of 25 to 30 mph with higher gusts will impact all islands of American Samoa tonight through at least Tuesday... * TIMING...tonight through Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Expect possible downed tree limbs as well as shifting
entry.cap:areaDesc: Manua; Rose Atoll; Swains Island; Tutuila and Aunuu

entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Georgia... Satilla River At Atkinson affecting Brantley County. Additional information is available at https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/forecasts.php?wfo=jax. The next statement will be issued Monday evening at 930 PM EDT. &&

entry.title: Air Quality Alert issued September 17 at 9:59AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Iowa DNR has issued an Air Quality Alert for fine particulate pollution, which is in effect for portions of west central and southwest Iowa through midnight tonight... Fine particulate levels near or above EPA health standards are expected to remain elevated today as smoke from wildfires in Canada settles into the area.

entry.title: Red Flag Warning issued September 17 at 8:53PM PDT until September 18 at 8:00PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINDY AND DRY CONDITIONS THROUGH MONDAY... .A pair of dry cold fronts will sweep through the region today and Monday, making for breezy conditions during the afternoon and evening hours each day. Winds are expected to be at their strongest on Monday, with RHs remaining at critical levels despite cooler conditions prevailing behind today`s front.

entry.title: Air Quality Alert issued September 17 at 12:23PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...AIR QUALITY ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT PDT TONIGHT... Oregon Department of Environmental Quality has issued an Air Quality Advisory...IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT PDT TONIGHT. A Smoke Air Quality Advisory has been issued. Wildfires burning in the region combined with forecasted conditions will cause air quality to reach unhealthy levels.

entry.title: Air Quality Alert issued September 17 at 4:09AM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...AIR QUALITY ALERT IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM PDT THIS AFTERNOON... Oregon Department of Environmental Quality has issued an Air Pollution Advisory...in effect until 5 PM PDT this afternoon. Wildfires burning in the region combined with forecast conditions will cause air quality levels to fluctuate and could be at unhealthy levels.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 17 at 9:33PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FOG AND PATCHY FROST TONIGHT... Areas of fog, some dense, and patchy fog will develop tonight across portions of northwest Wisconsin. The visibility in fog may drop to a half mile or less creating hazardous driving conditions in spots. The frost will be more likely inland from Lake Superior. If the dense fog becomes widespread, a Dense Fog Advisory may be

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 17 at 2:28PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...DENSE FOG AND PATCHY FROST EXPECTED TONIGHT... Areas of ground fog may become locally dense fog across central, north- central, and far northeast Wisconsin late tonight. Rapid reductions of visibilities below one quarter mile are possible in the fog, which could make the Monday morning commute hazardous at times. Where fog develops, visibilities are expected

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 17 at 10:50PM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Areas of Dense Fog Tonight... Areas of dense fog are developing across portions of the lowlands, with visibility below a quarter mile at times. Motorists should use caution if out driving and be prepared for sudden changes in visibilities. Please allow for greater distances between vehicles and do not assume the road ahead is unobstructed. Use low beam
